MC	<p>d6ed_33f8</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_0cf0</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_d76c</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_36be</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. MC	<p>1357_7394</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_a622</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_60d8</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_a434</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_d74b</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_7003</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_f3c2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_e679</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_3300</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 31px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td></tr><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;">A antigen</td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; font-size: 1.2em; color: darkred;">O%OO</span></p>	Incorrect	B. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; MC	<p>a719_6330</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_8871</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_c466</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_2546</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 16px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 20px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; MC	<p>bbb2_af8c</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_3c15</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 32px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 13px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 21px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 19px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; MC	<p>ca46_1869</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_b2a2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_13a5</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. MC	<p>94ab_114c</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_12bf</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_dc0b</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_6e83</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. MC	<p>8800_67d1</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_2f50</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_5c92</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_8323</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_0971</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_56c5</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_5cea</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_512a</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_7322</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_19c2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 30px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 12px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 19px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 21px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 28px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; MC	<p>1357_e5bb</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 1.2em; color: darkred;">%OOO</span></p>	Incorrect
MC	<p>94ab_7da9</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_7c6d</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_66f9</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_0cb1</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. MC	<p>8800_a650</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_9e1d</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_7dcc</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_65a9</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_4872</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_bf91</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_e646</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_3d72</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_5273</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_b9f1</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_0cf4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 18px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 31px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 17px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 18px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td></tr><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;">A antigen</td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; MC	<p>a719_e3fc</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 17px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 30px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 16px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 19px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 20px; MC	<p>94ab_5629</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_7a20</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 28px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 16px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 19px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; MC	<p>0ffc_77a3</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 21px; MC	<p>bbb2_7dc0</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 17px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 31px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 27px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 16px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 20px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; MC	<p>8800_08f4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_83b4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_7a47</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_ae20</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_3b75</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_5bda</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_d860</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_6460</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_37b7</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_bcb8</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_3ef1</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_341c</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_37dd</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><span style="font-size: 100px; color: red;">&#11054;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"> </td><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; MC	<p>bbb2_8e72</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_aba4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_b8df</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_eff4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_612a</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_cf88</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_75a3</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_67db</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_c90a</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_ce05</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_cd57</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_707e</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>a719_28b2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>94ab_00c8</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>d6ed_a141</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>0ffc_cb34</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bbb2_25b2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8800_0a05</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>ca46_78d2</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>1357_8888</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">A+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 18px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; MC	<p>a719_ae25</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 19px; MC	<p>94ab_f36d</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">AB+ blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 21px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 26px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 28px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 24px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 13px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td></tr><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 22px; color: darkred;">&#x25CF;</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; color: darkred;">.</span></td><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 25px; MC	<p>d6ed_9ac4</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">O- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px; border-color: black;"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 2px solid gray; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px solid white;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="150"><tbody><tr><td style="border: 0px solid white;"><span style="font-size: 23px; font-size: 1.2em; color: darkred;">%OOO</span></p>	Correct
MC	<p>bbb2_50dd</p> <p>During a blood typing test, anti-A, anti-B, and anti-D antibodies are added to a blood sample along with a control. A visible reaction indicates the presence or absence of the corresponding antigens.</p><p>What would the test results look like for someone with <strong><span style="font-size: 1.2em;">B- blood type</span></strong>?</p>	A. <p><table style="border-collapse: collapse;
